Quote: Mr Bradshaw, have you been thinking about going into education. Your talents must surely be wasted working as a mere librarian.
My promotion to Housemaster of Stirling Hall unfortunately left me with little time for actual teaching. I miss it on somedays when the paperwork piles up in my office.
Do you remember the incident with Ms. Gooding. Officialy the culprit was never found, but we both know what really happened that April.
From all the classes I've taught I haven't grow quite so attached to any than yours. And not only because my daughter was in it. Glad to see you've outgrown your ruffian stage.
I'm happy to announce that Belmont College could uphold our five year win streak in the yearly rowing competition against these dimwits from Fenwick College.
Back in my day, fencing as one of the high disciplines was held in tall regards. The cheeks of the current generation are hopelessly scarless.
I'm usually dubious of these modern sport inventions, but chess boxing majesticaly combines two disciplines I excelled in in my youth. Just ask the other teachers from our staff league.
Mr Bradshaw wouldn't you like to join our Alumni league and show Fenwick another time, whose institution excells in bodily fitness.
University funding is getting worse and worse. You should think that the future elites of this country would be worth more to the older generations.
Mr Bradshaw, would you like to join our Alumni program for teaching life experience to our young pupils. It is a quite honorable position, not to forget the monetary compensation.
The new budget plan for the next year has left me speechless. The school board really has no love lost for the fine arts. Natural sciences get all the benefits this year.
I've been very fortunate. I've come from a poor household, but I could provide a better start in life to my daughter. Now look around you. Her fame as an actress has financed all this.
Surely by now you noticed the Belmont in the living room. Pursuit of Gold. One of his older works and a true masterpiece. I received it as a gift from one of Belmont's descendants.
Lydia Monroe latest reveal Morning over Milford Marsh has shook the art world. She is a true embodiment of our schools artistic values! And a proud honour student of Stirling Hall.
The self portrait of Arthur Belmont, our honourable founder, still brings tears to my eyes whenever I pass it in the entrance hall. A true masterpiece.
Mr Sanders, if only you would have poured more time into pursuing your gift for painting, you could have made Belmont proud. Miniatures? Really? A student of your talents?
The High Court has passed a law banning gender studies classes from our curriculum. In a loophole I am now offering a dedicated club activity outside the normal teaching hours.
Have you heard that Vaughn is running for the Regressive Ideology Party. His platform is an honest disgrace of our schools values. But what more can you expect from Langley Hall.
I always tell the students that they can become anything, even a politician. Not because that is a desirable career, but rather the opposite. But we can teach them to become who they want to be.

Most politicians misuse their rhetorical talents to convince people to vote against their better interests. In that way they are just like any con artist you might find at a carnival. I'm not angry at them, just very dissapointed.
Don't waste your time on such insignificance. There are grander topics at hand.
Don't waste your time on such insignificance. There are grander topics at hand.
